`DivNet` is awesome!

## Vignette Info

This vignette will lead you through estimating diversity using DivNet

If there is something that you would like explained please feel free to request it!

## Loading the package and data

Download the latest version of the package from github.

```{r, results='markup'}
### Run the first two lines at home! ####
# install.packages("devtools")
# devtools::install_github("adw96/DivNet")
library(DivNet)

# let's simulate some OTU abundance data
set.seed(1)
my_counts <- matrix(rpois(30, lambda=10), nrow = 6)
rownames(my_counts) <- paste("Sample", 1:6, sep = "")
colnames(my_counts) <- paste("Taxon", 1:5, sep = "")

# 6 Samples, 5 taxa
my_counts

# let's make a covariate matrix
my_covariate <- cbind(1, rep(c(0,1), each = 3), rep(c(0,1), 3))
my_covariate

divnet(my_counts, my_covariate)
divnet(my_counts, my_covariate, variance="parametric")

```
